Paper.Title: TextTiling: Segmenting Text into Multi-paragraph Subtopic Passages

Section.Paragraph: Most work in discourse processing, both theoretical and computational, has focused on analysis of interclausal or intersentential phenomena. This level of analysis is important for many discourse-processing tasks, such as anaphor resolution and dialogue generation. However, important and interesting discourse phenomena also occur at the level of the paragraph. This article describes a paragraph-level model of discourse structure based on the notion of subtopic shift, and an algorithm for subdividing expository texts into multi-paragraph "passages" or subtopic segments.
In this work, the structure of an expository text is characterized as a sequence of subtopical discussions that occur in the context of one or more main topic discussions.
